name: ASUC South Asian Ad Hoc Committee
short_description: The South Asian Caucus Ad Hoc Committee is committed to uplifting the vibrant and diverse South Asian community at UC Berkeley by addressing the institutional gaps in representation, access, and support. Our mission is to create a more interconnected and empowered South Asian student experience through meaningful cultural programming, tangible resources, and cross-cultural collaboration.

name: *New Callink Feature: Blue Heart Initiative ðŸ’™
short_description: Joining Student Organizations using the Blue Heart Initiative The Blue Heart Initiative is a feature on CalLink identifying registered student organizations that are classified as â€˜open membership.â€™ These organizations may require a form to record demonstrated interest, but there is no formal application to be accepted into the organization. A blue heart [ðŸ’™] placed next to the organizationâ€™s name on CalLink indicates they meet this requirement and opted-in to this feature. Look for this blue heart as you explore organizations to join. The Blue Heart Initiative is brought to you by the Associated Students of the University of California (ASUC) and Organization Advising and Student Involvement Services (OASIS). Frequently Asked Questions: 1) Is my RSO eligible to participate? Any Registered Student Organization (RSO) that indicates they 'accept all' interested members during the yearly registration process are eligible. These organizations may require a form to record demonstrated interest, but there should be no formal application to be accepted into the organization. 2) How can my Registered Student Organization (RSO) sign-up and get a blue heart added to our name? Eligible RSOs will have the opportunity to opt-in to this initiative during the yearly RSO registration process. 3) When will the Blue Heart be added to our RSO's Name on CalLink? Blue Hearts will be added to RSO's Names on CalLink on a rolling basis as registration forms are processed. 4) Does it matter if my RSO is a Graduate RSO? No, Graduate and Undergraduate RSOs are eligible to participate in this program. 5) Does my RSO have to participate in this initiative if we are eligible? No, you are not required to participate in this initiative. Your RSO must consent to participating via the registration process. 6) How does my RSO opt-out if we are no longer open membership? Please have an RSO representative (ideally the same person who opted into the BHI) complete the Blue Heart Initiative Opt-Out Form. 7) What's the difference between an 'Application' and an 'Interest Form'? An RSO may use an 'Interest Form' to record contact and other information for internal purposes, but they will not use this information to evaluate whether you can be a member of their RSO or not. An 'Application' is a tool used to screen potential members for interviews and, ultimately, membership.

name: 180 Degrees Consulting at Berkeley
short_description: 180 Degrees Consulting is the world's largest student consultancy for the social sector, with 200+ branches around the world. At Berkeley, our branch keeps social impact at the forefront of our work, engaging with non-profits, social enterprises, and the corporate social responsibility divisions of for-profit enterprises. We aim to build a more compassionate, equitable world--one project at a time. Check out our website at https://www.180dcberkeley.com

name: 3D Modeling and Animation at Berkeley ðŸ’™
short_description: We are a student organization dedicated to education, research, and creation in fields encompassing, and related to, the production of 3D animation. We provide a group for students who are interested in working in the 3D animation or related industries, researching in relevant fields, or simply for students who are interested in learning about the topic. To facilitate a healthy ecosystem of support, we run a DeCal class called UCBUGG: 3D Modeling & Animation (http://www.ucbugg.com). We also host guest lectures related to the topic of 3D Modeling & Animation, to help students pursue their career and self-learning goals. To join, just hop on our Discord (https://discord.gg/ZUFgDry) and follow us on social media. That's it. No apps, dues, etc.
categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Academic Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, Blue Heart Initiative Category

name: AAAA - Furries at Berkeley ðŸ’™
short_description: The furry fandom is a subculture interested in anthropomorphic animals. Its origins date back to at least the 1980s in science fiction and comic conventions. Due to the diversity within the fandom, as well as fictional portrayals of the fandom based heavily on stereotypes, a certain amount of stigma and controversy is unfortunately associated with the fandom. The Anthropomorphic Animal Appreciation Association hopes to serve and portray the furry population on campus positively, as well as foster community collaboration between furries at Berkeley with other interest-based or academic groups.Follow Us :3 Bluesky | Twitter | Instagram | TikTok | Mailing List
categories: ASUC Sponsored 2025-26-Student Activity Groups, Recreational Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations, ABSA-Allocated Hearst Storage, Blue Heart Initiative Category

name: ABA
short_description: Founded in 1975, Berkeley ABA is a business organization with 5 teams: Business Development, Finance, Marketing, Non-Profit Organization, and Strategy. Our founders set out to provide a bridge between the professional world and the students of the UC Berkeley campus. Over the course of 45+ years of history, ABA has expanded its mission and now represents many diverse majors and cultures: ABAâ€™s mission as a business organization is to develop well-rounded business leaders who put our skills to work and never compromise our humility, integrity, or passion for each other and the work that we do. As such, we provide our members with opportunities to gain hands on professional experience through various industry-focused projects. ABA has become a well-respected organization on the campus, in the business community, and in the business world. With over 500 Alumni, it is the undergraduate business organization on campus with the largest alumni network.

name: ABC Sketches
short_description: While other groups occasionally make sketch comedy videos, none are fully dedicated to this activity. Furthermore, many of the comedy groups on campus are exclusive and/or require an audition process. ABC Sketches is about providing an opportunity to any and all creative and comedic minds to bring their sketch ideas to fruition. We want to meet frequently, film carefully, and produce our videos to perfection. After producing our videos, we hope to post them online to provide any viewers with a laugh. We also hope to submit our videos to appropriate competitions and festivals.
categories: Media & Publication Student Organizations, Undergraduate Organizations
